channel.title: Kubuntu: Screen resolution adjustment?
channel.description:
Hey, how do you adjust the screen resolution using Kubuntu? My screen went weird, were only half of the screen was intact, and the mouse only moved to the center. Like: <mouse selection here> <center of screen><mouse moves to here, apparently being where <<<<< is>.
So I restarted my computer and now the screen resolution is like rooted. The kstart button is like 5 cm by 5 cm, everything is huge. I have tried googling for the answer, yet to no avail. Seriously, I have tried quite a lot. The kstartmenu button is literally: ____________ | _ _ | | | |/ / | | |_| \_\ | |___________|
Curse my ASCII art, but oh well.

item.title: Kubuntu: Screen resolution adjustment?
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

then you broke it…(noob mistake that I’ve experienced many times)
you could reconfigure it by going to TTY1(Ctrl+Alt+F1) and login from there, and edit it using “sudo nano /etc/X11/xorg.conf”
but it would be best if you just configured it through the GUI in administrator mode in the control panel thing.
Just undo the changes you did(hopefully you remember, I forget the reconfigure command, MITB should remember it, or you could do some googling(I need to go to bed, so not right now)) if you can remember them. the default is JUST “nv” for all nvidia graphics cards(not the best but it works…) or you could use that one that starts with a V that you had earlier.
